course_overview.title: Deep Learning with TensorFlow
course_overview.description: Master the fundamentals of deep learning using TensorFlow, including neural networks, convolutional networks, and recurrent networks.
learning_objectives: Understand the basics of deep learning
Apply deep learning to real-world problems

modules.title: Module 1: Introduction to Deep Learning
modules.description: In this module, we will introduce the basics of deep learning, including neural networks, activation functions, and optimization techniques.
learning_objectives: Understand the basics of deep learning
Identify the key components of a neural network

sections.title: Introduction to Neural Networks
sections.content: This section will introduce the concept of neural networks, including the architecture, activation functions, and optimization techniques.

sections.title: Activation Functions
sections.content: This section will cover the different types of activation functions used in neural networks, including sigmoid, tanh, and ReLU.

sections.title: Optimization Techniques
sections.content: This section will introduce the different optimization techniques used in deep learning, including stochastic gradient descent and Adam optimizer.

questions.question: What is the primary function of a neural network?
answers: To classify data
To predict continuous values
To recognize patterns in data

questions.question: What is the purpose of an activation function?
answers: To introduce non-linearity to the network
To reduce the number of parameters in the network
To increase the number of layers in the network

questions.question: What is the primary goal of optimization techniques in deep learning?
answers: To minimize the loss function
To maximize the accuracy of the model
To increase the number of iterations

modules.title: Module 2: Neural Networks with TensorFlow
modules.description: In this module, we will implement neural networks using TensorFlow, including building and training a neural network.
learning_objectives: Understand how to build and train a neural network

sections.title: Building a Neural Network
sections.content: This section will cover how to build a neural network using TensorFlow, including creating layers, adding activation functions, and defining the loss function.

sections.title: Training a Neural Network
sections.content: This section will cover how to train a neural network using TensorFlow, including defining the optimizer, setting the hyperparameters, and monitoring the training process.

sections.title: TensorFlow Basics
sections.content: This section will cover the basics of TensorFlow, including tensors, sessions, and graphs.

questions.question: What is the primary function of the TensorFlow library?
answers: To perform linear algebra operations
To build and train neural networks
To perform data visualization

questions.question: What is the purpose of a session in TensorFlow?
answers: To create a new graph
To run a graph
To close a graph

questions.question: What is the primary goal of the optimizer in a neural network?
answers: To minimize the loss function
To maximize the accuracy of the model
To increase the number of iterations

modules.title: Module 3: Convolutional Networks
modules.description: In this module, we will cover convolutional networks, including convolutional layers, pooling layers, and fully connected layers.
learning_objectives: Understand the basics of convolutional networks

sections.title: Convolutional Layers
sections.content: This section will cover the basics of convolutional layers, including the kernel size, stride, and padding.

sections.title: Pooling Layers
sections.content: This section will cover the basics of pooling layers, including max pooling and average pooling.

sections.title: Fully Connected Layers
sections.content: This section will cover the basics of fully connected layers, including the number of neurons and the activation function.

questions.question: What is the primary function of a convolutional layer?
answers: To reduce the spatial dimensions of the input
To increase the spatial dimensions of the input
To extract features from the input

questions.question: What is the purpose of a pooling layer?
answers: To increase the spatial dimensions of the input
To reduce the spatial dimensions of the input
To extract features from the input

questions.question: What is the primary goal of a fully connected layer?
answers: To reduce the number of neurons
To increase the number of neurons
To classify the input
